thread.title: Ranking the top 10 college basketball players
thread.title_full: Ranking the top 10 college basketball players

title: Ranking the top 10 college basketball players
text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Ranking the 10 best college basketball players in the nation USA TODAY Sports college basketball writers Nicole Auerbach and Scott Gleeson pick the top 10 players in the nation each week based on overall team value and the season as a whole. Rankings are not based on NBA draft stock and alter each week based on most recent performances. Post to Facebook Ranking the 10 best college basketball players in the nation USA TODAY Sports college basketball writers Nicole Auerbach and Scott Gleeson pick the top 10 players in the nation each week based on overall team value and the season as a whole. Rankings are not based on NBA draft stock and alter each week based on most recent performances. A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 1 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Ranking the 10 best college basketball players in the nation None USA TODAY Sports college basketball writers Nicole Auerbach and Scott Gleeson pick the top 10 players in the nation each week based on overall team value and the season as a whole. Rankings are not based on NBA draft stock and alter each week based on most recent performances. Brad Tollefson, AP 1. Sophomore forward Caleb Swanigan, Purdue Boilermakers Mike Carter, USA TODAY Sports None 2. Senior guard Frank Mason III, Kansas Jayhawks. Denny Medley, USA TODAY Sports None 3. Senior guard Josh Hart, Villanova Wildcats. Bill Streicher, USA TODAY Sports None 4. Freshman point guard Lonzo Ball, UCLA Bruins. Russell Isabella, USA TODAY Sports None 5. Junior guard Nigel Williams-Goss, Gonzaga Bulldogs. James Snook, USA TODAY Sports None 6. Sophomore guard Luke Kennard, Duke Blue Devils Stephen R. Sylvanie, USA TODAY Sports None 7. Freshman guard Josh Jackson, Kansas Jayhawks. Andy Lyons 8. Freshman guard Malik Monk, Kentucky Wildcats. Mark Zerof, USA TODAY Sports None 9. Junior forward Dillon Brooks, Oregon Ducks Scott Olmos, USA TODAY Sports None 10. Junior forward Johnathan Motley, Baylor Bears Raymond Carlin III, USA TODAY Sports None HONORABLE MENTION: Alec Peters (Valparaiso), Grayson Allen (Duke), Marcus Keene (Central Michigan), Justin Jackson (North Carolina), Jayson Tatum (Duke), Melo Trimble (Maryland), Bronson Koenig (Wisconsin), London Perrantes (Virginia), Lauri Markkanen (Arizona), KeVaughn Allen (Florida), Dwayne Bacon (Florida State), De'Aaron Fox (Kentucky), Donovan Mitchell (Louisville), Markelle Fultz (Washington), Ivan Rabb (Cal), Kelan Martin (Butler), John Gillon (Syracuse).
